wikipedia_page.main: Lady Elizabeth Basset, DCVO (née Legge; 5 March 1908 – 30 November 2000), was an English author and courtier.

link_mentions.page: Royal Households of the United Kingdom

response: *Lady Elizabeth Basset (1908–2000), lady-in-waiting to Queen Elizabeth, the Queen Mother

*Ronald Lambart Basset (1898-1972; son), 2nd Scots Greys Regiment, married in 1931 Lady Elizabeth Legge (1908–2000), daughter of William Legge, 7th Earl of Dartmouth (1881–1958). She was appointed in 1959 an Extra Woman of the Bedchamber to Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother and became one of the Queen Mother's favourite and longest serving ladies in waiting. She was appointed DCVO.Obituary of Lady Elizabeth Basset, Daily Telegraph, 5 December 2000

*Bryan Ronald Basset, CBE (1932-2010; son); Chairman, Royal Ordinance,Obituary of Lady Elizabeth Basset, Daily Telegraph, 5 December 2000. who in 1987 oversaw the sale of the public-sector business and its 16 factories and 19,000 employees to British Aerospace.Obituary, EDP24, Britain's Regional Newspaper of the Year
*Lady Elizabeth Basset, 92, English author and courtier.
